project.name: Qt
project.description: The Qt project manages the Qt ebuilds within Gentoo.

longdescription.p: The Qt project handles the Qt ebuilds available in Gentoo's portage and the qting-edge overlay. It also maintains various Qt packages and libraries that don't have dedicated maintainers.

goals.p: The goal of the Gentoo Qt team is have fully functional, up-to-date ebuilds for the Qt toolkit and various Qt applications. We also maintain eclasses that ease creation and maintainance of ebuilds using Qt.

body.p: The latest stable version of Qt in the official Portage tree is 4.5.3 and the latest unstable one is 4.6.0
Various live versions of Qt ebuilds are available in the qting-edge overlay.

tr.ti: Nokia's 4.6-stable branch - tested to compile by Nokia
KDE's kde-qt branch - based on Nokia's 4.6-stable with KDE patches
Nokia's master-stable branch, currently 4.7 - tested to compile by Nokia

body.p: The overlay also holds various ebuilds for Qt applications and libraries not ready for the main tree, as well as newer, usually experimental versions of existing ones. If you have issues with these ebuilds, make sure you prepend your bug summaries with [qting-edge].
Please see the Gentoo Overlays Users's Guide to get all information on how to use overlays.

The Qt team has its meetings on the same day as the KDE team. We hold our regular meetings in #gentoo-meetings on the third Thursday of every month at 19:00 UTC. For earlier logs and summaries, please see the KDE team page.
Bugs, bugs, bugs! If you want to help, consider going through the Qt bug list: http://xrl.us/qtbugs. Any comment that can help a bug get fixed is always useful!
Those interested in writing ebuilds for Qt4 applications may find this tutorial useful: Qt4-based Ebuild HowTo.
Active contributors usually gain access to the qting-edge overlay to better help us with ebuild maintainance and can, in time, become full-fledged developers :)
To get in contact with the Qt team, drop by #gentoo-kde and chat with us, or send us an email at mailto:qt@gentoo.org.
